intro: Erythroxylum polygonoides, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
